ygData.subject: RE: Anti-Camping ?
ygData.msgSnippet: Good idea.. but with the new No Drop item patch, alot of the true goodies require a camp if you want em.. sigh.. ... From: That Transgirl
ygData.messageBody:
Good idea.. but with the new No Drop item patch, alot of the true goodies
require a camp if you want em.. sigh..



-----Original Message-----
From: That Transgirl [mailto:that_transgirl@...]
Sent: Wednesday, August 11, 1999 7:43 AM
To: EQ_rainbow@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [EQ_rainbow] Anti-Camping ?


From: "That Transgirl" <that_transgirl@...>

I often wonder if it isn't simply easier to hunt non-camped (or
lesser-camped) spawns and earn enough coin to buy the goodie I want from a
player that has one for sale...

Not only that, but I get to earn a lot of experience as I hunt another
critter while waiting for one to respawn.

Just a thought...



>I spent 9 hours straight waiting for jman's boots to spawn for me. They
>never did. Drelzna spawned during that time, she just didn't have the
>boots.
>
>There's no anti-camp code there, though. The place is camped on Tunare
>24/7
>and people come away with boots. A friend of mine went there and got them
>on the first spawn (the wench! ;)
>
>I think I just have horrible luck with spawns like this. The same thing
>happened for the BBC =P
